meanings.definition: To make (an activity or issue) political.
meanings.sent1: The students politicized the school election by campaigning for their favorite candidates.
meanings.sent2: The debate over healthcare quickly became politicized as politicians argued over the best approach.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pizza party was politicized when the students formed rival groups to support different toppings.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to wear a red shirt to the event politicized the otherwise casual gathering.
meanings.sent5: The mayor's speech successfully politicized the community to take action on climate change.

meanings.definition: To give a political character to.
meanings.sent1: The media often politicized the issue by framing it in a way that favored a particular political party.
meanings.sent2: The artist's work subtly politicized the gallery space, sparking conversations about social issues.
meanings.sent3: The cat politicized the household by choosing to only sit on the lap of the family member with the most political opinions.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds politicized the sky, casting a dark and ominous shadow over the city.
meanings.sent5: The protest signs effectively politicized the streets, drawing attention to the cause.
